Review_text: Seller: Indian Dental OrganizationPrice: 170/-Delivery:  6 days (Incl Sunday), 50/- Delivery Fee, BangalorePackage: Came in big box for a small tube!, no damageRecommended: yes, if you love foam-less brushing!After using Dabur paste for several years, recently came to light that it contains Methyl paraben which is on controversy discussion (whether it is harmful). So I don't want to take any risk any further and this paste came in to light. The paste contents appear all natural and almost no Preservatives (Going by the ingredient list). The paste looks grey color and it gets broken into pieces (True!) while you squeeze the tube to the bristles of your brush!. First time accidental flip will let all the paste fall on to your toes.This paste has no foam. Not sure if this is because of the lack of the preservatives. Foamless brushing is a bit risky if you have Medium or Hard brush type. You could possibly end up losing the tooth enamel!. I personally don't recommend this paste unless you have the awareness or if you have the habit of brushing so roughly!. The after brush feel is good because of Menthol. However, I feel that the menthol presence is little excess!.I recommend this product very much for it's complete natural. Even the famous Dabur Red advertises Ayurvedic but contains chemicals!, while this is free from all preservatives. However, foamless and the high price is the reason for 3 star. Hope my review is useful. Buy Natural and Be natural!

It includes all good ingredients and it ha sno chemicals. But after 20 days of use, the quality of the plastic went out and there was some holes in the plastic. And the toothpaste was becoming harder to bring it out.

It is a grey colored paste since it contains clay. It is sweet in taste, nothing weird. But a sudden switch from a foaming toothpaste to a non-foaming one will be difficult, because more product will be needed to get that clean-teeth feel. And if you already suffer from dental conditions please stay away from this one because it made my gum inflammation worse. Or atleast check with your dentist before using this product. Oral health is really important because if you cannot eat properly, then it will affect your overall health. So, don't risk your well-being. Besides even this a chemical product and no full ingredient list is present. I do not recommend this paste for dental sufferers. I felt instead of going for chemicals, lets use ayurvedic tooth powders which are safe and economical and really strengthens the teeth and gums when used regularly. Hope this helps.

Fluoride free is a marketing hoax. Period. I started using this toothpaste for 2 days & noticed stench on my breath along with a mild tooth ache. Fluoride is important for your teeth as it removes gems & other harmful bacteria in your mouth. Without it you're risking your dental health. There aren't enough research papers to prove fluoride free is safe & healthy for your teeth. Fluoride is dangerous only when your tap water contains above normal fluoride levels, so for most of us there isn't any requirement to go fluoride free.
